Arg.V:
#!/bin/bash
function updatepk() { if [ ! -z $1 ]; then if [ -e /var/run/yum.pid ];then exit 10 fi result=`yum -y update $1 2>&1` status=$? commandexist=`echo $result | grep -E "yum: command not found"` if [ "$commandexist" != "" ]; then exit 8 fi
commandexist=`echo $result | grep -E "yum: No such file or directory"` if [ "$commandexist" != "" ]; then exit 8 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "lock /var/run/yum.pid"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "/var/run/yum.pid: another copy is running"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "There was an error communicating with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "This system is not registered with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "No Repositories Available to Set Up"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "Error Class Code: 9 Error Class Info: Invalid System Credentials"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isscriptletfailed=`echo $result | grep -E "error:" | grep -E "scriptlet failed, exit status 255"` if [ "$isscriptletfailed" != "" ]; then exit 6 fi if [ $status -ne 0 ];then exit 7 fi fi } updatepk selinux-policy
exit 0

exit 0

Vulnerability.Title: selinux-policy bug fix update
Vulnerability.Description: The selinux-policy packages contain the rules that govern how confined processes run on the system. This update fixes the following bugs: Due to missing rules in the Gluster SELinux policy, the nfs-ganesha service failed to connect to the rpc.statd daemon after a node reboot in the situation where the nfs-ganesha server was installed on four nodes. The underlying code has been fixed, and nfs-ganesha no longer fails in the described scenario. (BZ#1333875) When the nfs-ganesha server was set up on four nodes with 2X2 volume, the volume was not exported after the nfs-ganesha service was enabled. With this update, a workaround has been provided which ensures that the volume is exported as expected in the described scenario. (BZ#1333903) Due to the denial of the Access Vectore Cache (AVC), refresh of the configuration file for the dbus message daemon failed in the situation where the nfs-ganesha server was installed on four nodes and volume was created. With this update, a workaround has been provided which ensures that the configuration file now refreshes as expected. (BZ#1340365) When the nfs-ganesha server was set up with a volume, and an attempt to mount this volume on a client within the Kerberos network was made, SELinux denied this Kerberos mount. This update ensures that the Gluster SELinux domain can read the Kerberos keytab files. As a result, the Kerberos mount is successful in the described scenario. (BZ#1344630) Users of selinux-policy are advised to upgrade to these updated packages, which fix these bugs. Note for remediation: Please disable the SELinux for RHEL 4/5 when repairing, or some rpm packages will fail to install.
